title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, red and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto:in graphite upper left on mount above drawing: bracket and "1/96"; along left side: bracket "repeat"; at right on mount: "satin" and "rep" with indicators on design; upper right corner: 2

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 38; iin graphite along right side:  8 motifs in 3 3/8 x 4 in  13 1/2
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of diamonds arranged in rows with lines executed in short parallel strokes

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Pink, red and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-456.
